description.narrative: The Institutional Design Research and Capacity Building initiative aims to increase local capacity to produce evidence-based research that will feed into the poverty reduction policy making process in Indonesia. The initiative is part of a larger strategy to revitalise the production and usage of knowledge in the policy making cycle in Indonesia and will deliver: two randomised control trials and lessons from these trials incorporated into social protection programming by the Government of Indonesia; a new research centre established with an Indonesian university, training scholars and hosting policy conferences; and relevant Government of Indonesia officials, researchers and representatives from partner organisations trained in randomised impact evaluation methods. The total value of this initiative is $5.7 million over 4 years, starting 2012-13.
